titleStmt.title: Two speeches spoken at Oxford by the Right Honovrable, Edward, Earle of Dorset before His Majesty and the lords of his Privy-councell the one at his receiving the office of Lord privy-seal : the other at his being made president of His Majesties Councell : shewing his good affection to the Parliament and the whole state of this kingdome.
titleStmt.author: Dorset, Edward Sackville, Earl of, 1591-1652.

titleStmt.title: Two speeches spoken at Oxford by the Right Honovrable, Edward, Earle of Dorset before His Majesty and the lords of his Privy-councell the one at his receiving the office of Lord privy-seal : the other at his being made president of His Majesties Councell : shewing his good affection to the Parliament and the whole state of this kingdome.
titleStmt.author: Dorset, Edward Sackville, Earl of, 1591-1652.

notesStmt.note: According to Madan the supposed Oxford edition probably does not exist.
Concerned with the functions of judges and councilors.
Reproduction of original in Thomason Collection, British Library.
